title: Rational Instructional Design and Core Competency Model Application for Nurse Orientation Program Reform

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic nursing duties and possession of clinical experience
context.additional_context: Establishing instructional design strategies for efficient orientation programs in large-scale workforce reduction and rapid turnover situations.

learning_goals: Learners can apply rational instructional design principles (e.g., ADDIE model) to create a 5-day orientation program redesign plan for new nurses (including objectives, content, methods, and evaluation) and earn over 4 points in at least three out of four 5-point scale evaluation criteria from two or more instructors and peer reviewers.
Ensure alignment (80%+ achievement) between learning objectives, assessments, and activities through competency-based curriculum development
Design efficient knowledge delivery methods for large learner groups (30+) in mobile microlearning environments

Learners can design a draft orientation process that simultaneously maintains organizational missions (performing over 80% of core tasks) and reduces costs (15% decrease in operational expenses) under a 1-week workforce reduction scenario (assuming 20% cuts) and achieve an "excellent" rating in at least two out of three predefined evaluation criteria: efficiency, effectiveness, and cost-efficiency.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
